thread.title: Circuit Court clerk caught up in federal probe of husband
thread.title_full: Circuit Court clerk caught up in federal probe of husband | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Circuit Court clerk caught up in federal probe of husband
text:
Federal agents went to the home of Cook County Circuit Court Clerk Dorothy Brown last week and seized her cell phone, a source has confirmed to the Chicago Sun-Times.
The visit seemed to indicate that an ongoing probe of Brown’s husband, Benton Cook III, has now expanded to include Brown herself.
Employees of the clerk’s office have received federal subpoenas.
Last May, Cook received a subpoena asking him to appear before a federal grand jury as part of an investigation into a state anti-violence program.
Federal authorities reportedly were looking into Cook’s role in receiving grant money from the troubled Neighborhood Recovery Initiative.
Cook was paid more than $146,000 for work on Gov. Pat Quinn’s scandal-plagued anti-violence initiative. But his biggest client, as it turns out, was Brown, records show.
Brown’s campaign fund paid the video production company based at her husband’s then-South Side home nearly $90,000 over a four-year period ending in 2010, according to Illinois State Board of Elections records. The business, Gideon Video Productions, doesn’t appear to have been licensed with the state of Illinois, the city of Chicago or Cook County.
This is a developing story. Check chicago.suntimes.com for updates.
